intro: Marsdenia gonavensis, commonly known as the Gonâve Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Gonâve in Haiti. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
